statement.p: Explain why the vector \left[\begin{array}{c} -10 \\ 9 \\ -6 \\ 4 \end{array}\right] is or is not a linear combination of the vectors \left[\begin{array}{c} -1 \\ -2 \\ 3 \\ 0 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{c} 4 \\ 0 \\ -2 \\ 1 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{c} 11 \\ 6 \\ -13 \\ 2 \end{array}\right] , \text{ and } \left[\begin{array}{c} -32 \\ -16 \\ 36 \\ -6 \end{array}\right].

answer.p: \left[\begin{array}{c} -10 \\ 9 \\ -6 \\ 4 \end{array}\right] is not a linear combination of the vectors \left[\begin{array}{c} -1 \\ -2 \\ 3 \\ 0 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{c} 4 \\ 0 \\ -2 \\ 1 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{c} 11 \\ 6 \\ -13 \\ 2 \end{array}\right] , \text{ and } \left[\begin{array}{c} -32 \\ -16 \\ 36 \\ -6 \end{array}\right].
